trial_identification.studytitle: An Assessment of the Feasibility and Safety of Conservative Oxygen Therapy in Critically Ill Patients
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Before-and-after Assessment of Conservative Oxygen Therapy vs. Standard Care in Critically Ill Mechanically Ventilated Patients

interventions.interventions:
Other interventions - conservative O2 therapy Other interventions - standard care
Placebo Comparator: standard care - normal treatment
Active Comparator: conservative O2 therapy - a value of 90-92% O2 saturation will be targeted
Other interventions: conservative O2 therapy target lower O2 saturation
Other interventions: standard care

primaryOutcome.outcome: Difference in PaO2/FiO2 ratio from baseline to worst value - Pao2/FiO2 ratio will be measured regularly and compared during standard care and the intervention period (a time frame of, on average, 10 days)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Lactate - blood lactate will be measured regularly and assessed during standard care and the intervention period

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Mechanical ventilation
- expected to be ventilated until the day after tomorrow (a tiem frame of, on average 48 hours)
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- expected to be off mechanical ventilation today or tomorrow
- carbon monoxide poisoning
- necrotizing fasciitis

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The investigators hypothesize that it is feasible and safe to deliver a conservative approach to oxygen therapy in mechanically ventilated critically ill patients (a tiem frame of, on average,10 days).
